channel.title: Comments on: T-SQL Tuesday #18: A Recursive CTE Is: A Recursive CTE Is
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Mike Donnelly
item.dc:creator: Mike Donnelly
item.description: I've used Recursive CTE's before and I usually get them to do what I want, but I always have to twist my brain to try and figure out how it is going to work. This week I decided I wanted to grok how they worked. I started reading through a couple blog posts a day until I could find one that would make it click for me. This is the best explanation I have found. I just wish I had started at the bottom of the list and read it on Monday.
item.content:encoded: I’ve used Recursive CTE’s before and I usually get them to do what I want, but I always have to twist my brain to try and figure out how it is going to work. This week I decided I wanted to grok how they worked. I started reading through a couple blog posts a day until I could find one that would make it click for me. This is the best explanation I have found. I just wish I had started at the bottom of the list and read it on Monday.

item.title: By: Andy
item.dc:creator: Andy
item.description: Thanks Jes, really good post and something which I reckon I'll use. Sometimes difficult to find SQL stuff that isn't beginner or expert, and for me this sits perfectly in the middle. Will have to re-read again tomorrow though to understand it all properly!
item.content:encoded: Thanks Jes, really good post and something which I reckon I’ll use. Sometimes difficult to find SQL stuff that isn’t beginner or expert, and for me this sits perfectly in the middle. Will have to re-read again tomorrow though to understand it all properly!

item.title: By: Brad Schulz
item.dc:creator: Brad Schulz
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jes…

The title of your post reminded me of the title I used for a post on Recursive CTE’s last year:

http://bradsruminations.blogspot.com/2010/03/this-article-on-recurson-is-entitled.html

I guess we Schulzes are on the same wavelength. 8^)

–Brad

item.title: By: Bob Pusateri
item.dc:creator: Bob Pusateri
item.description: Excellent post - I really enjoyed this. Had never messed with MAXRECURSION before so I totally learned something too! Thanks so much for contributing to T-SQL Tuesday!
item.content:encoded: Excellent post – I really enjoyed this. Had never messed with MAXRECURSION before so I totally learned something too! Thanks so much for contributing to T-SQL Tuesday!

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
Kendra Little has a good blog on the performance implications of this method

Filling in Data Potholes Redux: Tally Tables vs CTEs

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: great blog, and congrats on figuring out the recursive cte. it took me a while to figure those out.
